messages.content: What is the primary functionality of ComfyUI-Nich-Utils?
ComfyUI-Nich-Utils is a library containing utility nodes for ComfyUI, currently with a single node that allows for selecting a random image from a provided folder.
What features does the Image from Dir Selector node offer?
The Image from Dir Selector node offers features such as pinning a single image, searching within subdirectories, and filtering images using a regular expression.
Is ComfyUI-Nich-Utils currently stable and bug-free?
No, ComfyUI-Nich-Utils is still in early development and may contain bugs or oddities.
Can you give an example of how the Image from Dir Selector node might be used?
The Image from Dir Selector node can be used for tasks like selecting a random image for IPadapter or cycling controlnet poses.
What is planned for future development of ComfyUI-Nich-Utils?
Future work for ComfyUI-Nich-Utils includes improving code, adding tests, and developing more nodes.
What change was made in v0.0.4 regarding file naming?
In v0.0.4, ComfyUI-Nich-Utils added the ability to expose the filename with and without its extension.
In which pull request was the filename with and without extension exposed?
The filename with and without extension was exposed in pull request #5 on GitHub.
What improvement was made to the 'Keep Current' feature?
The 'Keep Current' feature no longer reloads the image under normal circumstances, but it still reloads when switching from False to True.
What new feature was introduced in v0.0.2 for navigating image directories?
In v0.0.2, the ability to traverse subdirectories was added.
What functionality did ComfyUI-Nich-Utils provide in its initial version?
The initial version of ComfyUI-Nich-Utils offered regexp filtering, the ability to keep the current image, and the capability to persist settings to workflow JSON.
What persistence feature was implemented in the first version?
In the initial version (v0.0.1), the plugin implemented a feature to persist settings to workflow JSON.
In which version was the image random generator protected from external influences?
The improvement to ensure the image random generator was not influenced by outside sources was made in v0.0.3.
